verbose_text: Ferritin is produced by glial cells (microglia and Bergmann glia) to bind the heme into hemosiderin; however, the production of ferritin is eventually overwhelmed with resultant neuronal damage.3 Superficial siderosis is subclassified into " infratentorial " superficial siderosis given its predilection for the posterior fossa and to distinguish it from the cortical superficial siderosis associated with cerebral amyloid angiopathy or previous isolated subarachnoid hemorrhage.
evidence: Ferritin is produced by glial cells (microglia and Bergmann glia) to bind the heme
